posts.name: Adan Silva
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! We started work on getting our elevator/arm automated using PID control while also taking advantage of the new inline command factories. However, every time we press one of our  buttons binded to a command to set the goal, nothing appears to happen. No movement from them whatsoever. When pressing our binding to go to manual control, we are obviously able to use both subsystems. Any ideas on what can be possible going on? Here is the branch in question:

elevator-stuff

The source code for the 2023 FRC robot. Contribute to frc3512/Robot-2023 development by creating an account on GitHub.

Thank you in advance!

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: 3512A | Part-Time Software Help | Cal Poly SLO 27 |

posts.custom_user_title: 3512A | Part-Time Software Help | Cal Poly SLO 27 |

posts.cooked:
First of all, your code is clear, idiomatic, and well-written! Well done!

I don’t see any glaring issues. As a debug step, can you ensure that the commands that are supposed to run are actually running? This can be helpful: The Command Scheduler — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: The Command Scheduler — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: Didn’t know that existed…. Is their a shuffleboard widget for events?

Nope, it’s an event in the recording. We should probably change the example as Shuffleboard recordings aren’t very commonly used these days.

Just use a print statement or DS.reportWarning() . Or a DataLog.log() if you’re feeling fancy.

posts.name: Adan Silva
posts.cooked: Ok! Thank you for the suggestion, we’ll try it tomorrow when we meet again.

posts.name: Adan Silva
posts.cooked: I was able to get our commands to get scheduled! However, a new issued popped up! The motors are just stuttering towards the bottom of the elevator when a new setpoint is set, with no effort to move towards the top.
